dataset_id: ISLSCP II Global Primary Production Data Initiative Gridded NPP Data
title: ISLSCP II Global Primary Production Data Initiative Gridded NPP Data
summary: Net Primary Production (NPP) is an important component of the carbon cycle and, among the pools and fluxes that make up the cycle, it is one of the steps that are most accessible to field measurement. Direct measurement of NPP is not practical for large areas and so models are generally used to study the carbon cycle at a global scale.  This data set contains 2 *.zip files for above ground and total NPP data.

citation: Hashimoto, S., K. Nanko, B. Tupek, and A. Lehtonen. 2017. Data-mining analysis of the global distribution of soil carbon in observational databases and Earth system models. Geoscientific Model Development. 10(3):1321-1337.

Zhang, F., Ju, W., Chen, J.-M., Wang, S.-Q., Yu, G.-R., & Han, S.-J. (2012). Characteristics of terrestrial ecosystem primary productivity in East Asia based on remote sensing and process-based model. Chinese Journal of Applied Ecology, 23 (2), 307-318.
